main event: On December 13, 1957, in Canton, Ohio, a ground-visual observation was made of a round gold object the size of a basketball, moving slowly east and in sight for 4 seconds.
interesting points: The object was described as a round gold object, moving at a slow pace, and was in sight for a short duration of 4 seconds.
The military identified the object as a balloon and concluded that there was insufficient data for evaluation.
The report provides no analysis or final evaluation of the sighting.
The location of the sighting was Canton, Ohio.
The report does not indicate any photographs or images associated with the observation.
sighted object: round gold object the size of a basketball
